pull.title: [bench] Avoid function call arguments which are pointers to uninitialized values
pull.body:
Prior to this commit:

```
bench/checkblock.cpp:41:5: warning: Function call argument is a pointer to uninitialized value [clang-analyzer-core.CallAndMessage]
    stream.write(&a, 1); // Prevent compaction
```

events.message: [bench] Avoid function call arguments which are pointers to uninitialized values

events.body: @laanwj Thanks for the quick review! This PR is now limited to fixing the two uninitialized values in `src/bench/checkblock.cpp`.
Uninitialized values are fine if they are not read?

@MarcoFalke it looks like these are read, however (well, copied and never acted on, but still technically undefined behavior).

utACK 218d915445b5936c2de1ffe1e2c97b3f3d20becc
Adding link to ["Always initialize an object" (ES.20)](https://github.com/isocpp/CppCoreGuidelines/blob/master/CppCoreGuidelines.md#es20-always-initialize-an-object) in the C++ Core Guidelines.

issue.title: Update benchmark suite
issue.body:
Updating the bench suite with a bunch of goodies, among them linux perf profiling. This will be needed to evaluate more efficiently an upcoming port from BCHN that will probably improve the performance of the RPC interface.   

This PR contains a series of port from Core: 

bitcoin/bitcoin#11517
bitcoin/bitcoin#12757

comments.body: A NUL terminator is unnecessary here, as the array is not interpreted as a string.
